{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the description of the child presenting with multiple permeating lesions involving all the bones of the body, the most probable diagnosis is histiocytosis X. Histiocytosis X, also known as Langerhans cell histiocytosis (LCH), is a rare condition characterized by the proliferation of abnormal Langerhans cells. These cells can infiltrate multiple organs, including the bones, and cause destructive lesions. Neuroblastoma, metastasis from osteosarcoma, and metastasis from Wilm's tumour are less likely as they typically do not involve all the bones of the body.", "answer_choice": "C"}
